gov.loc.repository.bagit.transfer

Class BagFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.loc.repository.bagit.transfer.BagFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cancellable, ProgressListenable

    public final class BagFetcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cancellable, ProgressListenable
    Fetches a bag. This class is not thread-safe.

    The default failure strategy for the fetcher will be StandardFailStrategies.FAIL_FAST. A new failure strategy may set with the setFetchFailStrategy() method.

    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Brian Vargas
    See Also:
    FetchFailStrategy, StandardFailStrategies

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Description copied from interface: Cancellable

        Cancels a long-running operation. The operation may not be terminated immediately, but may end at the earliest possible convenience of the implementor.

        Consecutive calls to this method must not have any additional effect.

        The Cancellable.isCancelled() property must be set to return true by the end of the cancel method.

        The state of the operation after a cancel is undefined by this method, but gurantees may be made by particular implementors.

        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Cancellable

      • isCancelled

        public boolean isCancelled()
        Description copied from interface: Cancellable
        Whether or not the operation has been canceled. That this method returns true only indicates that a request to cancel has been registered - the operation may still be performing work until some convenient time to exit is reached.
        Specified by:
        isCancelled in interface Cancellable
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Cancellable.cancel() method has been called; false otherwise.

        Specified by:

        public FetchFailStrategy getFetchFailStrategy()
        Gets the current fetch failure strategy.
        Returns:
        The currently set failure strategy. Will never be null.

      • setFetchFailStrategy

        public void setFetchFailStrategy(FetchFailStrategy strategy)
        Sets the failure strategy for this fetcher instance. The failure strategy should be set prior to beginning the actual fetch operation. Behavior is undefined if the strategy is set after the fetch() method has been called.
        Parameters:
        strategy - The new strategy to use. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if null is set.
